xxl.core.pipes.memoryManager
Interface Strategy

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractStrategy, UniformStrategy
public interface Strategy

Interface for strategies for distribution of main memory. A strategy must be able to manage the registration and deregistration of memory-using objects and it must ensure that the total memory usage never exceeds the total amount of available memory. The strategy is also responsible for the distribution of memory among the memory-using objects.

Since:
1.1

Method Detail

register

void register(MemoryMonitorable memUser)
Registers a memory-using object. The object has to call requestformemory() to get memory.

Parameters:
memUser - the memory-using object to register.

deregister

void deregister(MemoryMonitorable memUser)
Deregisters a memory-using object.

Parameters:
memUser - the memory-using object to deregister.

getMemUsers

Iterator<MemoryMonitorable> getMemUsers()
Returns an iterator of the registered memory-using objects. They implement the memorymonitorable or memorymanageable interface.

Returns:
Returns an iterator of the memory-using objects.

getManageableMemUsers

Iterator<MemoryManageable> getManageableMemUsers()
Returns an iterator of the registered memory-using objects. They implement the memorymanageable interface.

Returns:
Returns an iterator of the memory-using objects.

getNoOfManagedMemUsers

int getNoOfManagedMemUsers()
Returns the number of actually registered manageable memory-using objects. They implement the memorymanageable interface.

Returns:
Returns the number of actually registered memory-using objects.

getNoOfMonitorableMemUsers

int getNoOfMonitorableMemUsers()
Returns the number of actually registered monitorable memory-using objects. They implement the memorymonitorable or memorymanageable interface.

Returns:
Returns the number of actually registered memory-using objects.

setGlobalMemSize

void setGlobalMemSize(int newGlobalMemSize)
Sets a new global amount of main memory.

Parameters:
newGlobalMemSize - The new global amount of main memory (in bytes).

getGlobalMemSize

int getGlobalMemSize()
Returns the global amount of main memory.

Returns:
Returns the global amount of main memory (in bytes).

getCurrentMemUsage

int getCurrentMemUsage()
Returns the total amount of memory which is actually assigned to the registered memory-using objects.

Returns:
Returns the total amount of assigned memory (in bytes).

requestForMemory

void requestForMemory(MemoryMonitorable memUser,
                      int newMemSize)
Receives a request for an amount of memory from a memory-using object.

Parameters:
memUser - the requesting memory-using object.
newMemSize - the desired amount of memory (in bytes).

assignMemSize

void assignMemSize(MemoryManageable memUser,
                   int newMemSize)
Assigns a special amount of memory to the specified memory-using object.

Parameters:
memUser - the memory-using object as the recipient of the assignment.
newMemSize - The amount of memory to be assigned (in bytes).

detectOverflow

boolean detectOverflow()
Detects whether a memory overflow has occured or not.

Returns:
Returns true if an overflow has occured.

handleOverflow

void handleOverflow()
This method handles a memory overflow (i.e. it has to solve it). The distribution of main memory among the memory-using objects is mainly coded in this method.
